[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 154]
Reasoning: **Analysis and Execution: The Mark Boss Blind**

Okay, let's break this down. Ante 5, round 14. I'm up against "The Mark," and I need 22,000 chips. I'm currently at 19,005, meaning I need about 2,995 more, and I've only got two hands left. The Boss effect of flipping cards face down after a hand is played is annoying, but irrelevant for *this* round since we are about to win. The next action is the Shop, so I'm safe.

I have some key Jokers: Gros Michel (big mult), Egg (value), Droll (more mult on a Flush), Perkeo (consumable copy), and Blue Joker (chips per card). I have two "The Moon" consumables that can convert cards to Clubs. Let's see what I'm working with:

My hand consists of: Jack of Hearts, 3 of Hearts, 9 of Clubs (bonus), 6 of Clubs, 2 of Clubs, 8 of Diamonds, 7 of Diamonds, 2 of Diamonds. I've got a lot of Clubs already, but I need a Flush to be sure.

My initial thought was to use one "The Moon" to convert some cards to Clubs, get a Flush, and win. But wait, I have two "The Moon" cards. I'm thinking I can convert the Jack and 3 of Hearts with Moon, then convert 8 of Diamonds and then I have a club flush! I can use the consumables on positions 1, 2, and 6. Then I can play it as a flush:

Clubs: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 (Jack, 3, 9, 6, 2).

So, let's calculate. A Flush Level 4 gives 80 chips. The Blue Joker adds +38, the 9 of Clubs gives +30 bonus. The card values (Jack, 3, 9, 6, 2) total 30. That's 178 chips total. Mult: Base 10 + Gros Michel 15 + Droll 10 = 35 mult, times the Polychrome 1.5 = 52.5 mult. 178 * 52.5 = 9345 chips. Okay, 9345 is more than the required 2,995 chips.

This works. 

I'm thinking ahead to the next round, and how Perkeo works at the end of the *shop*. Using one "The Moon" in this round is fine because Perkeo will copy the remaining Moon at the end of the next shop. Great, this gives me good synergy.

Here's the plan:
1.  **Action:** Use "The Moon" on cards at positions 1, 2, and 6 to get the flush.

So the first action is `{"action": "use_consumable", "positions": [1, 1, 2, 6]}`

Now I play the hand.



Command: use_consumable 1 1 2 6

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.

**My Celestial Pack Selection**

Looking at my current hand levels and usage, Flush is at Level 4 and I've played it 15 times. Straight Flush is Level 2 and has not been played. Straight is also at Level 4 and played once. Two Pair is at Level 1 and has also never been played.

Given my Joker setup – Droll Joker boosting Flushes and Perkeo copying "The Moon" – I'm clearly focused on Flushes. "The Moon" effectively lets me build a single-suit deck by converting cards to Clubs. With that in mind, I need to evaluate these choices.

Uranus (Two Pair) is out; I *never* play that. Saturn (Straight) is decent because it already has a good level, and it *is* levelable, but I have only played it once. But it is not my focus.

Neptune (Straight Flush) is the most intriguing. The +4 Mult and +40 chips are great, but the Straight Flush is hard to get, and I haven't even played it. But, with Perkeo and "The Moon", I'm rapidly moving towards a predominantly Clubs deck. This conversion makes Straight Flushes not only *possible* but a very viable long-term strategy and a possible game ender!

My "Last Played Hands" confirm the plan: it is all Flushes except for one High Card, so I should focus on that to take advantage of the Droll Joker. 

Since I'm not seeing Jupiter (Flush), Neptune is the best choice. While it's a Straight Flush, it *contains* a Flush. My Droll Joker will still trigger! If I happen to get a Straight Flush, it's a huge power spike. Uranus and Saturn don't really synergize with my "The Moon" strategy as much.

There's no reason to skip; any level up is better than none. Neptune's higher scaling (+4 Mult, +40 chips vs. +3 Mult, +30 chips for Saturn) solidifies its position as the best choice.

So, I'm selecting Neptune. The action will be to select the card at position 2.
